poem:
### Pop-Up Alchemy

In preloved silks and threadbare tweeds,  
where labels lose their shine,  
the ghosts of garments find new breath,  
cloth-relics lined in time.  
Where charity's hands weave tapestry,  
in corners of the city,  
cast-off garments spun again,  
a patchwork of modernity.  
Threads stitched with stories,  
rise anew,  
where secondhand dreams  
are born anew.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Charity Super.Mkt to open more pop-ups amid rising demand for secondhand clothes The secondhand clothing pop-up Charity Super.Mkt is set to head to Edinburgh, Leeds, Sheffield and the heart of London’s Canary Wharf financial district as it opens a dozen more stores next year catering to a rise in interest in shopping for preloved items. The initiative, which has brought together 55 local and national charities in the UK, including Age UK, Oxfam, Barnardo’s, Traid". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
